All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.lookup.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.settings.SettingsTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.PackagePathTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.traits.LanguageTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.traits.TryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.resource.ResourceTrait
public abstract class Microservlet<Request extends MicroservletRequest,​Response extends MicroservletResponse> extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.Named
A microservlet responds to requests by implementing onRequest(MicroservletRequest). The response object must be a subclass of MicroservletResponse.

The request and response type for a microservlet are provided by requestType() and a responseType(). Parameters to a microservlet can be retrieved in a subclass with parameters() and the as*() methods.

IMPORTANT NOTE

For most applications, it isn't necessary (or desirable) to directly subclass Microservlet. Instead a (MicroservletRequest request handler should be mounted directly on a MicroserviceRestService with the MicroserviceRestService.mount(String, HttpMethod, Class).

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
MicroservletRequest, MicroservletResponse, PropertyMap
